page.title: 08Bentley Wood,Winterslow.
page.content: This occupies about 1700 acres to the west of West Tytherley Village, and is known to have existed before 1200A.D. The original name for Tytherley means young wood.(Domesday Book).Recently the wood has been bought from the Forestry Commission by the Estate of the late Lady Coleman of Middleton Manor,Winterslow.A trust manages it for the benefit of wildlife and local people.It is designated a conservation area.A plan is to reduce substancially vast numbers of coniferous trees and re-plant with deciduous. Wildlife includes the sika deer introduced by the Washington Singer family at Norman Court before World War 1.Birds include the nightingale,tree pippit,woodcock, woodpeckers,pheasant,partridge and barn owl.The area is managed but open for study.(see another page)
